Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all my opinions about mining changed when I got my first FPGA, you are correct @jl777c

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: BTCH going to (150,5) sounds vaguely interesting

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: (150,5) + 50% PoS would be what it migrates to, that would balance things

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: no way to add mining to BTCH without increasing supply, and the super simplest thing that works is doubling it to 42M, which I call "Satoshi's Double Vision"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if we did this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the entire set of BEAM miners become potential BTCH miners, which is interesting

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i haven't heard of any publicly available bitstream for 150,5

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but obviously FPGA dev companies write bitstreams and run privately without ever telling their customers. They do have some transparency with customers, tho

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: HAC tells me which bitstreams they are working, or will write soon, if price increases, things like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but they could just be running a BEAM bitstream in the back room for 3 months before ever giving it out to customers. Only makes sense to give it to customers if they can't make more money using it privately

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: what I think is happening is this: ASIC companies have promised 150,5 asics

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this makes FPGA companies not consider it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but some enterprising FPGA miners are probably running privately-funded BEAM bitstreams, which will never make it into the hand of a "customer"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: until those ASICs make them run away

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for 3 months straight, reliability and all that

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: if i recall right, doge cannot be mined directly. it simply misses the getblock and getblocktemplate

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: only getauxblock and submitauxblock stayed

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: but if you look the profitability of pool, that has auxes listed in SHA256, the coins difficulty doesn't change, as aux is not separate chain, but the auxcoins main chain.

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: most auxes still allows mining it straight, but since most are also listed at biggest pools to get small extra profit over normal coins, the auxes diff usually is high. seriously high

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so the boost to ROI is fraction of a percent?

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: yes.

Author: Ondalf#1318
Content: then there is this oddball called Globaltoken, which has ability to use it as auxpow for equi200,,9 and 144,5. best part, it needs own flags and version number to be able to work with them... haven't yet got it to work. shouldn't be hard though. this GLT also has ability to mine as an aux, when main coin is POS one (PoW+PoS one)
